articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Grealish inspires Villa to rare away win at Burnley
articles.description: Struggling Aston Villa picked up their second away win of the Premier League season, securing three vital points in a 2-1 win at Burnley on New Year's Day, their first league win at Turf Moor since 1936.
articles.content:
BURNLEY, England (Reuters) - Struggling Aston Villa picked up their second away win of the Premier League season, securing three vital points in a 2-1 win at Burnley on New Year’s Day, their first league win at Turf Moor since 1936.

articles.author: Sudarshan Varadhan
articles.title: Coal-fired plants around New Delhi running despite missing emissions deadline
articles.description: Coal-fired utilities around New Delhi were still operating on Wednesday despite threats from the Indian authorities to close them down if they had not installed equipment to cut emissions of sulfur oxides by the end of the year.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI (Reuters) - Coal-fired utilities around New Delhi were still operating on Wednesday despite threats from the Indian authorities to close them down if they had not installed equipment to cut emissions of sulfur oxides by the end of the year.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Turkey may not send forces to Libya if conflict eases
articles.description: Turkey may hold off from sending troops to Libya if forces loyal to eastern commander Khalifa Haftar halt their offensive against the internationally recognised government in Tripoli and pull back, the Turkish vice president said on Wednesday.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iraqi militias start withdrawing from U.S. Embassy
articles.description: Paramilitary groups who have been protesting against U.S. air strikes in Iraq began to withdraw from the perimeter of the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad on Wednesday, although some supporters remained.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Paramilitary groups who have been protesting against U.S. air strikes in Iraq began to withdraw from the perimeter of the U.S. Embassy in Baghdad on Wednesday, although some supporters remained.

articles.author: Prapan Chankaew
articles.title: Thailand kicks off 2020 with plastic bag ban
articles.description: Thailand began the year with a ban on single-use plastic bags at major stores, continuing a campaign launched by the government and retailers towards a complete ban in 2021 to reduce waste and debris in the sea.
articles.content:

articles.title: Democrat Buttigieg's presidential campaign raises $24.7 million in fourth quarter
articles.description: Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg raised $24.7 million in the fourth quarter, his campaign announced on Wednesday, well ahead of the $19.1 million he collected in the third quarter.
articles.content:

articles.title: Federal judge temporarily exempts truck drivers from California gig worker law
articles.description: A federal judge has temporarily blocked a California labor law meant to take effect from Jan. 1 from impacting over 70,000 independent truckers by granting a 'temporary restraining order.'
articles.content:
(Reuters) - A federal judge has temporarily blocked a California labor law meant to take effect from Jan. 1 from impacting over 70,000 independent truckers by granting a ‘temporary restraining order.’

articles.title: Loser in Guinea Bissau election cries foul, will contest result in court
articles.description: The loser in Guinea Bissau's presidential election, Domingos Simoes Pereira, will contest the result with the Supreme Court, he told supporters on Wednesday.
articles.content:
BISSAU (Reuters) - The loser in Guinea Bissau’s presidential election, Domingos Simoes Pereira, will contest the result with the Supreme Court, he told supporters on Wednesday.

articles.title: Britain's Lloyds Banking Group suffers hours-long online outage
articles.description: Britain's Lloyds Banking Group suffered an outage on Wednesday that left customers of its Lloyds, Halifax and Bank of Scotland operations unable to access accounts online for several hours.

articles.title: New Year brings hope, grief to Somali family devastated by bomb blast
articles.description: As wounded men screaming for their mothers were brought into a Mogadishu hospital after a huge truck bomb on Saturday, doctors fought to save eight month-old Mohammed Hassan, whose mother was already dead.
